column2: et opera manuum ejus adnuntiat firmāmentum. ^ The heavens show forth the glory of God
column3: and the firmament declareth the work of his hands.

column2: et nox noctī indicat scientiam. ^ Day to day uttereth speech
column3: and night to night showeth knowledge.
quōrum nōn audiantur vōcēs eōrum. ^ There are no speeches nor languages
column4: where their voices are not heard.

column1: 5 ^ In omnem terram exīvit sonus eōrum
column2: et in fīnēs orbis terrae verba eōrum. ^ Their sound hath gone forth into all the earth
column3: and their words unto the ends of the world.

column2: et ipse tamquam sponsus prōcēdens dē talamō suō. Exsultāvit ut gigās ad currendam viam. ^ He hath set his tabernacle in the sun
column3: and he as a bridegroom coming out of his bridechamber. He hath rejoiced as a giant which shall run the way.

column2: et occursus ejus usque ad summum ejus
column3: nec est quī sē abscondat ā calōre ejus. ^ His going out is from the end of heaven
column4: and his circuit even to the end thereof
column5: and there is no one that can hide himself from his heat.

column1: 8 ^ Lēx Dominī immaculāta convertens animās; testimōnium Dominī fidēle
column2: sapientiam praestans parvulīs. ^ The law of the Lord is unspotted
column3: converting souls; the testimony of the Lord is faithful
illūminans oculōs. ^ The justices of the Lord are right
column4: rejoicing hearts; the commandment of the Lord is lightsome

column2: permanens in saeculum saeculī; jūdicia Dominī vēra
column3: jūstificāta in sēmet ipsā. ^ The fear of the Lord is holy
column4: enduring for ever and ever; the judgments of the Lord are true

column1: 11 ^ Dēsīderābilia super aurum et lapidem pretiōsum multum
column2: et dulciōra super mel et favum. ^ More to be desired than gold and many precious stones
column3: and sweeter than honey and the honeycomb.

column1: 12 ^ Etenim servus tuus cūstōdit ea; in cūstōdiendīs illīs retribūtiō multa. ^ For thy servant keepeth them
column2: and in keeping them there is a great reward.

column1: 13 ^ Dēlicta quis intellegit? Ab occultīs meīs mundā mē
column2: ^ Who can understand transgression? From my secret ones cleanse me

column1: 14 ^ et ab aliēnīs parce servō tuō. Sī meī nōn fuerint dominātī
column3: et ēmundābor ā dēlictō maximō. ^ and from those of others spare thy servant. If they shall have no dominion over me
column4: then shall I be without spot
column5: and I shall be cleansed from the greatest sin.

column1: 15 ^ Et erunt ut complaceant ēloquia ōris meī
column2: et meditātiō cordis meī in conspectū tuō semper. Domine adjūtor meus
column3: et redemptor meus. ^ And the words of my mouth shall be such as may please
column4: and the meditation of my heart always in thy sight. O Lord
